byline.contributor: Jim Yardley reported from Rome, and Laurie Goodstein from New York. Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome.
byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and LAURIE GOODSTEIN

abstract: Pope Francis announces all Roman Catholic priests will be allowed to offer absolution for abortion, which brings automatic excommunication under church's canon law, during Holy Year of Mercy that begins in December.
lead_paragraph: All Roman Catholic priests may offer absolution in the coming year to women who had abortions and want to return to the good graces of the church.

headline.main: Pope Francis Eases Path to Absolution for Abortion
headline.print_headline: Pope Francis Eases Path to Absolution for Abortion

snippet: All Roman Catholic priests may offer absolution in the coming year to women who had abortions and want to return to the good graces of the church.
